column1: touch short outside off and Roy climbs into it first ball, not cleanly timed but clubbed on the up over cover for a couple to start off
back of a length, 146kph and snaking back in, Roy lets it go
shortish, swinging away this time, Roy shuffles across but won't reach it
length ball, 145kph/90mph and sliding into the pads, Roy flicks him fine... and it runs all the way for England's first boundary!
straying leg side again and Roy diverts it a bit squarer, Kane Richardson cuts it off at fine leg this time
back of a length, dabbed down into the on side and they scamper through
good length, 144kph and Hales prods forward, gets a thick edge through square leg
pitched up in the channel and boomed through cover for four! Hales gets going with his first boundary
dropped! Maxwell at backward point, he seemed to be going the wrong way, off balance and grassed despite getting both hands to it
length, 135kph and swatted into the covers

swing for Richardson, Roy chases it on the drive - but plinked off the toe to extra cover! Impetuous shot, nowhere near the line and Richardson bags the opening wicket, Roy trying to crash it on the up over the off side again but dollying up a simple catch. Looks like a slower delivery, in fact
short, worked off the body for one behind square on the leg side
angled in on a length and tapped down
pitched up and that's four more! Stanlake's pace is being used to better effect by England, Malan timing one off his toes
short, 144kph, he latches on to the pull but clatters it to midwicket
off, that's a shot... full outside off and Malan steps out to cream a drive in princely fashion to the cover rope!
swung over deep backward square - that's a Dorothy! Superb maneouvering of the bowler, Malan shuffles across and just impudently flicks it using the pace, sails all the way for England's first six
pitched up and clipped off the pads for a couple through midwicket
better line, Malan shows it a straight bat
treatment for Richardson now! Hales backs away and the bowler follows him, heaved into the leg side and away
responds well, slower delivery in the channel, Hales is duped and fails to connect
oof, this gets through, 140kph and nibbling a fraction, past the bat as Hales hangs back
squeezed past backward point, gets it away! It was in the air for a while, as Hales chopped down on it, but Maxwell couldn't get there
fired in straight and worked to leg for one
in the channel, 140kph and sliding across, Malan watchfully lets it go
urgh, that's off line, short and leg side and helped on its way over the head of short fine leg for four more
good length, 130kph around off stump and blocked
short and down the leg side, two men back now and Hales slugs a single to deep square
slower delivery, on the pads and tucked through square for one
dropped into the covers coming across
slower delivery, again leg side and Malan tucks one more off his pads
short, taking the pace off, nudged to leg
dragged down and Malan swats one to deep backward square leg
fullish, squirted towards backward point and there's some momentary confusion, meaning Hales has to race to the non-striker's end... but Maxwell's throw was high
slower ball, Malan tries to pull... and loops it short of mid-on!
full, offcutter, Malan gets a big stride in and whumps it over cover, skips away in front of deep point for four
short, 134kph but it's leg side and Malan aggressively cracks it the fence at deep backward square for another boundary to end a productive Powerplay for England

round the wicket, angled in and straightening, pops off the leading edge - and Agar dances around Malan backing up to take a smart low catch! He lost sight of it momentarily but took it without drama. Australia break through
angled across from round the wicket, tapped to backward point
tossed up on the stumps, Morgan works it with the spin through midwicket to get off the mark
good stuff from Malan, reversing the hands and swiping it past short third man for a couple
drops a touch short, Malan stands up and punches off the back foot through point
darted in flat and quick, flicked through the leg side
poor ball to start off, slings down a full toss from round the wicket and Morgan bullies his first boundary through cover
fired in and driven, Warner gets a hand on it in the covers but can't prevent a couple
tossed up and plonked into the stand at wide long-off! Looked like a mishit off the bat, but it went a full 90 metres!
dobbed on off stump with the arm and tapped away
floated up, punched in front of square
angled in flat, Malan nudges one more through mid-on
starts with a low full toss but Malan doesn't get hold of it
banged in at 140kph, above head height as Malan sways under it
length ball pitching outside leg, 148kph, jumps down and tries to hit across the line, it deflects off the pads
fired in full, Morgan blocks it back to the bowler
slower ball, comes out full again, Morgan doesn't cash it as he collars one through square leg
goes full and wide of the stumps now, 144kph and Malan doesn't strike it cleanly, rolls to mid-off
length ball, on the pads and dumped beyond the ropes again! Malan goes biggedy-biggedy-bong, just a club cricket heave to leg and it sails almost into the England dugout at deep midwicket
darted in flat and patted back to the bowler
flighted, Morgan swings hard across the line, gets a big top edge over the keeper and it spins away for a couple
slugged over cover, Maxwell gives him a fraction of width and Morgan belabours it in front of deep point

got 'im! Morgan goes for a hasty swipe down the ground and top edges to the edge of the ring! Nicely bowled by Maxwell, tossed it up a bit more, Morgan wasn't to the pitch and mishit the ball straight up, Warner steadying himself well at mid-off to take the catch
pushed through on the body, worked away to leg
goes over the wicket, darted in on off, Buttler squeezes out an inside edge to get off the mark
tossed up from round the wicket and punched wide of mid-on
flat on the stumps, tapped away

pushed through outside off, beats the bat... and Australia go up for the catch behind! Not given but Warner decides to review Gerard Abood's call. Looks to have slid past the edge by some distance, nothing on Hot Spot, so Malan will continue
lobbed up full and Malan sweeps one through square leg
flat, 88kph on off stump, punched through the covers coming forwards
oh, good placement, Malan skips down and splunks four more! Used the feet and cracked the ball into the gap between long-on and deep midwicket - that's the England 100 up, too
floated up on the stumps and worked through midwicket
slower ball, wide of the stumps and Malan leans out to stroke a Test-match drive to the cover sweeper
short ball, sits back and guides one down to third man
foxed him, banged in short at full pace and Malan can't time his pull, wears the ball on the shoulder with it then deflecting up into his helmet
another slowie, on the pads and worked through square leg for one
length, angled in and Buttler can only prod it back to the bowler - good over, just the four runs off it
pitched up straight and punched down the ground to long-on
goes for the tramlines... but slides outside for an extra

fullish, 129kph in the channel... and Buttler plops it straight into the hands of mid-off! Caught in two minds, I think, not a full-blooded drive, maybe duped by a cutter and he ended up chipping it to man on the ring
length ball, 132kph on off, Billing shows it a classical straight bat in defence
fired in at the pads and Billings works his first run through midwicket
slower bouncer, Malan watches it through outside off... called wide, though
full on leg stump, driven down the ground for a single
full on the pads, clipped through square leg
length ball outside off, Billing drives.. and snicks four wide of the diving Carey! That's one way to get 'em
fullish outside off, 137kph and sliced for one to third man
clubbed over mid-off, bottom hand comes off the bat, lands short of long-off
back of a length and worked away off the hip to fine leg for a couple
length, sticks in the pitch and Billings gets a leading edge... but it lands safely in the covers and they nip through for one more

tossed up, grip and spin, Billings' leading edge this time goes straight back to the bowler! Australia chipping away, a second return catch for Agar, this one even more straightforward. Billings frowns to himself and strides off
stays round the wicket, fired in and tapped back
pushed through in the channel and angled away behind point
flighted, Malan heaves into the leg side, not a great connection and they can't come back for two... But that's his fifty, second in consecutive T20 innings for England
tossed up and poked into a gap through mid-off
sliding on with the arm outside off, Malan tries to get cute with a reverse-ramp sort of doohickey... but misses
fired in outside off, stabbed square
flat, Willey stands in the crease and clubs a single through the covers
tossed up and Malan slog-sweeps... picks out deep backward square leg! Maxwell strikes again and England's anchor is sunk, Malan safely pouched just in front of the rope for a round 50
stumped, Willey loses his head! And his wicket... A misbegotten charge and Carey whips off the bails, Willey nowhere near getting his foot back
fired in flat on leg stump, nudged through square leg
floated up and Jordan props forward
length outside off and Rashid swats it towards point
taking the pace off, back of a length outside off and Rashid swings and misses

banged in short, Rashid pulls and picks out deep square leg! Looked like Rashid was through his shot early, maybe expecting it to be quicker, and it flew off the toe of the bat straight to Stoinis, who clasped it low down in front of him
short of a length outside off and Jordan carves a couple away through backward point
quick, sliding in with arm, hit on the thigh hanging back
wallop! Curran hooks his first ball into the crowd at deep square leg! Dug in short by Stanlake, 138kph but there's no mucking about and he mows it several rows back
full outside off and driven square
does him for (lack of) pace and Curran is gone second ball! Trying to whack it down the ground, completely foxed by the knuckleball and chipped to Warner backpedaling from mid-off
worked into a gap
pitched up outside off, Wood plinks into the covers and they scuttle through as the throw comes in
slow delivery outside off and dabbed square
well bowled, the cutter rising in the corridor as Wood pokes at it and misses
slower delivery, rising up outside off, tapped down for one
back of a length, Wood backs away and flails at it without making contact
slower,  the offcutter bounces past the shoulder of the bat as Wood stays in the crease
full outside off and taking the pace off again, heaved through midwicket off the inside edge
fired in quick, 135kph with Jordan stepping out to drill a drive to the cover sweeper
slips in the yorker to finish the over, Wood blocks it
full and clubbed high into the off side, he's managed to land it between deep cover and Warner running back from mid-off for a couple
takes the pace off, Jordan gets a looping leading edge into the covers, almost two there, as well, but he slipped trying to turn
back of a length and rising over the stumps as Wood swings in vain again
slower delivery outside off and Wood carves it away through backward point, Stoinis does well in the deep to prevent four
pitched up, 133kph and drilled down the ground to long-off
Jordan whups it into the stands it deep midwicket! Stand and deliver, a meaty hoick across the line and it takes England past 150 in the process. But will that be competitive?
ping! On a good length, Warner plants the front foot and biffs hard and straight over the top of the bowler's head!
short, pulled, out! Utterly leathered, but straight to deep square leg. And, well, we've got fireworks already!
hint of inswing on a leg-stump line, cramping the Popeye-forearmed Lynn for room
more inswing, and straight through the gate! Perfect line and length, Lynn's feet went nowhere as he heaved meekly down the wrong line, and we've got a contest
ooh, well bowled, rolled the fingers, and just nibbled past the edge
swing again, but down the leg side
up on the toes, punched into the covers
outside off, takes the edge, and nudged down to third man
back of a length, attacking the splice, and defended back down the pitch
banged in short, hauled out through square leg. Nailed it
punched off the back foot, through the covers, that's good counterattacking cricket
hoicked out through midwicket, hitting down on the ball all the time to maintain control, well intercepted on the midwicket boundary
good riposte, a sharp lifter outside off, induces a flinch
poked off the back foot to point
pow! That is vast, picks the length so early, and pounds a high handsome swing into the stands at square leg
much fuller, attacking the toes, and chiselled to midwicket
back of a length, a bit of late swing, and an inside-edge cannons off the midriff and down into the crease
stand and deliver, and battered out through cow corner. Willey's length has gone walkabout in this over
inside-edged drive to deep backward square
drilled on the up out through backward point
on the pads, tucked into the leg side
clipped into the leg side, just back of a length, quick call for the single
eased into the covers, as the pace comes off the ball
chiselled on the up, out through the leg side
another slower ball, inswinging into the right-hander, and tucked into the leg side. A fine over, applying a bit of a handbrake to Australia's progress
short and leg-sided, attempted pull but under-edged as Curran rolls his fingers on the ball
another slower ball, arriving with the momentum of a powder-puff, and tapped into the leg side
flicked off the legs out to deep midwicket. England are getting into the groove now after Short's initial flurry
a massive yahoo from Maxwell as he retreats to leg and attempts to pound a drive high over the covers
another swing of the bat, inside-edged out through square leg this time

another slower ball, but too short this time from Curran, and Short has all the time in the world to size up his swing of the blade and dump a massive six over the bowler's head. A dent in an otherwise decent over
whipped off the hip and just out of the reach of short backward square! It was timed and placed to perfection in the end...
retreats to leg and attempts a mow, but straight to point
no qualms about this one! Back of a length, picks the slower ball, eases onto the back foot and slams an uppercut of a pull out into the midwicket stands!
backs away again, and slices a slap over the covers! Unconventional but highly effective, clearing the ring and racing to the rope
low full toss, on the pads, flipped to the leg side

attempted yorker, strikes the toes as Short stumbles at the crease, and England are reviewing.Looks like there's no bat involved, but it is definitely leg-sided. Sure enough, pitched outside, and on we go
decent line and length, tapped to the leg side
nudged off the toes
big spin! Maxwell leans forward but is beaten by late dip
googly, but picked early and battered into the stands! Fractionally too short as well, plenty room to swing the arms
backs away, slaps on the up, and high over the covers! That is tremendous batting
drilled along the ground to complete another brisk over. And England need a breakthrough rather urgently
low full toss, and dropped at deep square leg! Flicked off the toes, and Hales is the culprit, a bit of a goober if truth be told. Is that England's opportunity gone?
back of a length and beats the outside edge
slower ball, back of a length, thumped to cover with a loud 'grr' as Maxwell feels he missed out there
another low full toss, on the pads and tapped to midwicket
tickled off the pads to short backward square, another slower ball
that's tremendous, an open-faced glide through third man, pure placement, and England look bereft of answers right now
sharp spinning googly, beats the left-hander
sliding into the pads this time and worked to leg
tucked to midwicket again, looking for the single

tossed up, battered back at the bowler, and plucked in one hand in front of his face! A stunning instinctive take, Rashid didn't know much about that to be honest, but he spread his fingers wide and has given England a glimmer
back of a length, a gently turning legbreak
wrong'un, down the leg side
beautiful follow-up, a late dipping, sharp turning legbreak, and Buttler whips off the bails as well... the umpires are taking a precautionary look. The toe wriggled, but nothing untoward there
punched to mid-off
back of a length, angled into the right-hander, nudged to point
sharp from Wood, jumping wide on the crease and lifting past the edge of a tentative push
thumped to cover off the back foot
walloped to point
crunched to cover off a full length
a humungous mow as Rashid rips his legbreak. That's an eyeopening amount of turn
tossed up again but slides straight on. Cunning variations
a cracking slap over the covers. Clears the front leg and pounds the bat through the line, and up comes his half-century from a decidedly brisk 30 balls
back of a length, thumped hard through midwicket where Malan does brilliantly with a full-length dive to save the four
tossed up again, luring Maxwell down the pitch but he can't beat short cover on the drive
whittled to the leg side from back of a length
short and sharp, and just about within the margins for an above-the-shoulder wide. Barely, in fact...
wide on the crease, and cramping Maxwell on the back foot
smashed through the covers, a welcome opportunity to release the pressure
oops, he's gone and given it away! A wild swipe on the up, and top-edged to mid-off, where it plops, with goober-like ease, into Sam Billings' hands
good delivery, back of a length, beats the splice and through to the keeper. There's a slip in place for the new batsman, as Morgan goes hunting for wickets
angled defence into the off side
outside off, reverse sweep, well placed behind point
nudged on the up out to long-on
whoops. A big legbreak but starts wide and goes wider

misjudged from Maxwell, a weak front-foot biff over the covers, and almost misjudged by Roy at long-off as well! The umpires are checking, as Roy had to lean forward at the last minute to scoop it off the turf, and well, this looks short of his fingers, but the soft signal is out... this is a huge call. And it is NOT OUT! Such a tight call either way. Roy looks utterly nonplussed.
striding forward, thumped to cover
nurdled to midwicket
tucked into the leg side
thumped down to long-off
a sliced drive into the covers, utterly nailed, head over the ball and flinging his hands through the line. But straight to the sweeper
backs away for a slap, Jordan sees him go and follows him with the bouncer, and a cue-end slides down to third man
another slow bouncer, mistimed on the pull to backward square
eased down to long-on
outside off, yorker length, beats an ambitious slap through point
slower ball, thumped down to long-off
worked to mid-on
another slower ball, squeezed out to deep point
yorker, sharp delivery, and good running too, as the dug-out delivery rolls up the pitch to cover
slow again, back of a length, pinged with intent to deep square leg, but Willey's tumbling stop cuts off the four. England are taking this deep
smeared across the line, more good contact but the sweepers are back on the legside boundary, and Jordan cuts this off with ease
back of a length, wide of off stump, Head attempts to biff the leather off this one, but can't connect properly
battered high and hard over long-off, there's the precious boundary, but Roy nearly puts his head straight through the boundary hoarding in his eagerness to intercept!
pounded through the leg side once again, to Roy's right this time, and now Australia are cooking again!
deflects off the legs, well gathered by Willey in his followthrough, and his shy pings the stumps! Safely home though ...
timber! Inswinging yorker, and that'll help England's cause!
punched on the up to mid-on
on the pads and worked square
inside-out drive through point, a full-length delivery outside off, and that's tremendous
Maxwell is turning on the Big Show now! Battered on the up, an arrow-straight blade, and that's an excellent intercept from Billings at long-on
smashed in the air ... is this the chance England need? No, Billings bales out of the catch and opts to defend the boundary instead
full length once again, flicks the pads and worked to leg
inside-edged into the pads, and rolls into the off side
short, slow, outside off, dabbed to backward point
a slashed slog high over point, plugs in the deep and the sweeper slides round to gather
another slower ball, and pounded through midwicket! He hangs on the back foot, waiting for the ball to arrive, then slaps it, tennis-style into the gap
tucked to leg, and a frantic sprint to make it back for two, keeping the strike and hustling into the 90s ... it's On!
clears the front dog, slams the bat through the line, another slower ball is dispatched over the covers...
low full toss, crunched up and over the covers, just out of the reach of the back-pedalling fielder, and they come back for two ... He's probably blown his hundred now!
on the back foot, a tucked single to the leg side ... and Maxwell is on strike with the scores level!
banged in short, battered hard into the covers, but can't beat the field
swung mightily over the leg side, and it plops over the rope for the century! Stunning batting from the Big Show who, frankly, was the only show in town today.
